RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 18400. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances). .
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SEND ME ON tracked the leader while waiting inside, slipped through entering the stretch, was bumped past the three sixteenths pole, put to a right handed crop once near the furlong marker then drew off at will through the final furlong to win as his rider pleased. SERENDIPITOUS made the lead soon after the start, set the pace into the stretch, drifted out then in bumping the winner past the three sixteenths pole then was no match while clearly second best. DEER CREEK ROAD never far back, loomed boldly three wide on the second turn then was outfinished. KARAMEL CORN trailed for over a half then passed tiring rivals three wide. PLATE IT UP failed to menace. JOES A ROCKIN pressed the pace two wide into the far turn then weakened. HEIDI'S SINATRA was no factor. MA MOO POWER unhurried, offered a mild bid four wide into the far turn then flattened out.

ENTRY.NAME: Send Me On
ENTRY.COMMENT: waited inside, slipped through, bumped upper stretch, much best

ENTRY.NAME: Serendipitous
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed to lead, set pace, bumped upper stretch, no match winner

ENTRY.NAME: Heidi's Sinatra
ENTRY.OWNER: Eyerman, Lee J. and Molumby, John
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Joes a Rockin
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 2 wide, weakened far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Deer Creek Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, middle move, 3 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Ma Moo Power
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle move, 4 wide, flattened out,

ENTRY.NAME: Karamel Corn
ENTRY.COMMENT: passed tiring rivals, 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Plate It Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 2 1M Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 30100. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not ConsideredIn Weigh t Allowances).

CLAIM.OWNER: Burnsworth Richard and Ultra Championship Racing LLC

RACE.FOOTNOTES: WINDY LU WHO away alertly, set the pace along the inside into the clubhouse turn, gave up the lead before a quarter, shifted two wide, prompted the pace into the stretch, dug in under mild right handed urging through the final stages and proved best by a narrow margin. MISSION GIRL assumed the lead two wide before a quarter, set the pace along the inside under pressure from the winner while getting slow fractions into the stretch, dug in gamely and just missed hanging on. SHE'S CRAFTY stalked the pace while saving ground into the stretch, moved closer approaching the furlong marker, shifted to the three path late and finished with good courage. HIGH FIRE vied for the lead three wide into the stretch then faded. ABIGAIL LEE trailed, was taken outside entering the far turn and passed a tiring rival. STAR RULES was taken outside shortly after the start then faltered after a half.

ENTRY.NAME: Windy Lu Who
ENTRY.OWNER: Pocket Aces Racing LLC and Susan Anderson Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: early lead inside, shifted 2w, pressed, long drive, 2 wide, prove

ENTRY.NAME: Abigail Lee
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, taken outside 2nd turn, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Star Rules
ENTRY.COMMENT: taken outside start, through after half,

ENTRY.NAME: Mission Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed to lead 2 wide, set slow pace inside, just failed

ENTRY.NAME: She's Crafty
ENTRY.OWNER: Poe Racing Stable LLC and 8 and 3 Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, closed upper stretch, altered 3path late, good try

ENTRY.NAME: High Fire
ENTRY.OWNER: Boots N Bikinis LLC and Jones Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied for lead, 3 wide, faded lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 17400. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JUNE 4. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MANNFORD pressed the pace three then two wide past the seven sixteenths pole, made the lead, set the balance of the pace and finished full of run under confident handling to win as much the best. OHIO PLAYER broke slowly, rushed to contention five wide before a quarter, drew on near even terms for the lead nearing the quarter pole then was no match for the winner. ROLLIN SO PERFECT unhurried early, found his best stride late two wide. HONOR THE D failed to menace. ACCURATE was a forward factor five then four wide through the turn, swung wide and lost ground. BABA LOOEY had brief speed. FOREIGN set the early pace along the inside and was through after a half.

ENTRY.NAME: Honor the D
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Foreign
ENTRY.COMMENT: early pace inside, through after half,

ENTRY.NAME: Rollin So Perfect
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, best stride late 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Baba Looey
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief speed,

ENTRY.NAME: Ohio Player
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke slowly, rushed to contention 5 wide, drew even, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Mannford
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed3-2wide, took over entering turn, drew off, much the best,

ENTRY.NAME: Accurate
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed 5-4wide, swung wide, lost ground, 7path

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 14100. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SWELTER chased the pace for six furlongs, took over at the top of the stretch then drew off while full of run under a strong hand ride to win as much the best. GRAND GIZMO never far back, offered a mild bid in the four path entering the stretch and finished second best. STREET MAX saved ground and finished with good courage along the rail. KILLER BEE void of early speed, had a mild rally late in the three path. INSACIABLE PRINCE was no factor. MR LAOBAN was no threat. ESTILO FAVORITO sprinted to a daylight lead soon after the start, set the pace to the top of the stretch then was used up. MINDSHIP Q chased the early pace and was through after six furlongs. THE GOSPEL OF MARK broke alertly, dropped back and was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Street Max
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, finished determinedly

ENTRY.NAME: Insaciable Prince
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Grand Gizmo
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, bid 4path top lane, no match for winner,

ENTRY.NAME: Swelter
ENTRY.OWNER: Blazing Meadows Farm LLC and Hertrich III Frederick
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, took over top lane, much the best, hand ride

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Fred W. Hertrich lll & John D. Fielding

ENTRY.NAME: The Gospel of Mark
ENTRY.COMMENT: outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: Estilo Favorito
ENTRY.COMMENT: sprinted clear, set pace top lane, used up,

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Laoban
ENTRY.COMMENT: no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Killer Bee
ENTRY.COMMENT: void early speed, mild rally late 3path

ENTRY.NAME: Mindship Q
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, through after 6furlongs

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 17400. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JUNE 4. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EL MARRO vied for the lead five wide down the backstretch, took over near the three furlong marker, dropped inside entering the stretch, shook clear before the furlong marker and prevailed under confident handling MISTER MOBIL allowed to settle, advanced steadily in the four path and finished clear for second in a determined effort. MUCHO PRIMO battled for the lead two wide into the turn, dropped back a bit then outfinished others while three wide. ATTACK ANGLE never far back, improved position through deep stretch four wide. SPIN DOCTOR trailed early and passed tiring rivals five wide through deep stretch. THE MAN CAN dueled for the early lead three then two wide and weakened late. BISCUITS AND GRITS contested the pace along the inside into the turn, checked when in tight nearing the quarter pole and lost momentum. JACK BE FAST gained a brief early lead, matched strides into the turn four wide and gave way. THE STEWARDS POSTED THE INQUIRY SIGN BUT TOOK NO ACTION.

ENTRY.NAME: Attack Angle
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, improved position 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Biscuits and Grits
ENTRY.COMMENT: contested inside, checked, in tight 1/4 pole,

ENTRY.NAME: Mister Mobil
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, steady advance 4path, good effort,

ENTRY.NAME: Mucho Primo
ENTRY.COMMENT: battled 2 wide, dropped back turn, outfinished others 3wide

ENTRY.NAME: The Man Can
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 3-2wide, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Jack Be Fast
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief early lead, speed turn, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Spin Doctor
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed early, passed tiring rivals 5wide

ENTRY.NAME: El Marro
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied 5 wide, took over turn, shook clear, driving,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 12200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).

CLAIM.OWNER: R and P Racing Stables, LLC

RACE.FOOTNOTES: KERANOS unhurried early, closed with a rush four wide through deep stretch and got up in the final strides. AWESOME ENOUGH stalked the early pace, rallied four wide through the tur to gain a narrow lead at the top of the stretch, matched strides two wide to the wire and gamely gained second. ON HIS TOES dueled for the lead three then two wide and was outfinished in a game effort. CONSIDER ME contested the lead two wide then along the inside until deep stretch then weakened. SILVER MATT never far back, advanced in the five path into the stretch then leveled off. SEEING RED well placed, failed to respond. PAPA CHARLES broke awkwardly, trailed early, moved up along the rail into the stretch then lacked room at the furlong marker and lost momentum. ARMOR PIERCING was no factor. ESTILO CLASICO battled for the lead lead along the inside and was through after a half. GOTIGER SPECIAL was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: Seeing Red
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, failed to respond,

ENTRY.NAME: Estilo Clasico
ENTRY.COMMENT: battled inside, through after half,

ENTRY.NAME: Consider Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2wide, inside, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: On His Toes
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 3-2wide, outfinished gamely,

ENTRY.NAME: Awesome Enough
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked early, rallied 4 wide turn, battled to wire, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Papa Charles
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward start, in tight rail mid stretch,

ENTRY.NAME: Silver Matt
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle move 5path, failed to sustain bid,

ENTRY.NAME: Keranos
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, closed with a rush 4 wide, up in final strides,

ENTRY.NAME: Armor Piercing
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Gotiger Special
ENTRY.COMMENT: through early,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 7 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Claiming Purse 12100. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 4 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ENCHANTED MELODY never far back, closed willingly outside rivals in the eight path through the stretch and got up in the final strides. CONSTITUTIONALIST rushed up two wide to gain a narrow lead before a quarter, set a pressured pace through the turn, edged clear in upper stretch, drifted out to the seven path under right handed urging and just missed hanging on. FLASH OF CHEROKEE stalked the pace in the four path through the turn, moved closer outside the leader in upper stretch, shifted inside that one to the five path late and finished with good courage. KEENE ON JENNY trailed through the turn then passed tiring rivals three wide. ITALIAN TWIN failed to menace. BEAUTY IN MOTION stalked the pace three wide into the stretch then weakened. DIAL FOR LOVE was hustled along, pressed the pace along the inside into the stretch then gave way. SURPRISED GEM had brief speed.

ENTRY.NAME: Surprised Gem
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief speed,

ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled along, pressed inside, gave way lane

ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, passed tiring rivals 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Constitutionalist
ENTRY.OWNER: Siesta Thoroughbred Racing Rossi Gregg and Toporcer Greg
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed to lead, set pace, drifted 7path, caught

ENTRY.NAME: Beauty in Motion
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 3 wide, weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Enchanted Melody
ENTRY.OWNER: R and P Racing Stables, LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, closed willingly outside, up in final strides,

ENTRY.NAME: Flash of Cherokee
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 4path, bid outside leader, angled in late, determinedly

ENTRY.NAME: Italian Twin
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 8 1M Dirt CR: 90. Allowance Purse 40900. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of $22,000 Since October 4 Allowed 3 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (Highest Earnings 2022-2023 Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HENRY MAC with the second flight three wide, rallied five wide through the far turn to make the lead at the top of the stretch and drew off under mild left handed urging. OAKS HONEY brushed at the start, was allowed to settle, loomed boldly along the rail into the stretch and finished clear for second. RAVEN MOON brushed at the start, was always within striking distance, split horses three wide past the quarter pole then was outfinished. NEED TO KNOW BASIS failed to menace. VISUAL MISSION was no factor. SERVE REVENGE COLD sprinted to a daylight lead soon after the start, set the pace for six furlongs then was used up. MR LOOOCH chased the pace into the far turn, loomed boldly then three wide nearing the top of the stretch then came up empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Need to Know Basis
ENTRY.OWNER: WinStar Farm LLC and Blazing Meadows Farm LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Oaks Honey
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed start, loomed boldly rail, clear second

ENTRY.NAME: Raven Moon
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed start, split horses 3 wide 1/4 pole, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Visual Mission
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Serve Revenge Cold
ENTRY.OWNER: Urieta Racing Stable and Sadey David
ENTRY.COMMENT: sprinted clear, set pace 6furlongs, used up,

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Loooch
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased, loomed boldly 2-3wide, empty,

ENTRY.NAME: Henry Mac
ENTRY.OWNER: Samuel Klein Jr LLC and Enjoy The Ride Stable LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: second flight, closed 5 wide 2nd turn, drew off, left urging

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 9 6F Dirt CR: 92. Allowance Purse 27500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 125 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 4 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AZTEC stalked the pace into the stretch, rallied three wide to make the lead neat the furlong marker and edged clear late under brisk handling. AQUITANIA ARRIVAL well placed, loomed boldly along the rail in upper stretch then couldn't handle the winner. GOING IN STYLE sprinted to the lead soon after the start, set the pace off the rail into the stretch and faded late. AGNELLO'S DREAM pressed the pace two wide while hung out in the five path and weakened in the stretch. ORO DE MORO MORO unhurried early, swung wide and passed tiring rivals in the seven path. BEACH HOLIDAY settled inside and lacked the needed response. NEPOTISM failed to menace. CREDIT RIVER closed up along the inside into the stretch wilted late.

ENTRY.NAME: Going in Style
ENTRY.OWNER: Lion Palm Racing Stable and Sixth Gear LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed to lead, set pace off rail, faded late

ENTRY.NAME: Beach Holiday
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Agnello's Dream
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 2 wide 5path, weakened stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Credit River
ENTRY.COMMENT: closed inside, wilted late

ENTRY.NAME: Oro de Moro Moro
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, swung wide, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Aquitania Arrival
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, loomed boldly rail, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Nepotism
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Aztec
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, rallied 3 wide, 1/8pole lead, driving,
